intro: Coleosanthus diffusus, commonly known as the broadleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, waxy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins and wetlands. Coleosanthus diffusus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
